Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw plants that have enough water and show them looking healthy (green and standing up).
The student can draw plants without water and show them looking unhealthy (brown, wilting, or drooping).
The student can include a sunlight source in the drawing for the healthy plants to show they need both water and light.
The student can organize their drawing to show both plants with water and plants without water side by side to compare the differences.
The student can use their drawing to explain that plants need water to live and grow.
